author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Airports in India may face reduced user development fees for lapses like dirty toilets, baggage delays, and long queues, as per a proposal from the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority (AERA). The regulator plans to implement uniform performance standards for major airports, linking compliance to tariff structures with rewards for exceeding standards and penalties for failures.
title: Bags delayed, toilets dirty? Regulator plans penalty for airports

author: SUMIT ROY
description: WWE's Rhea Ripley, in Paris for Clash at the Castle, faced an unsettling incident when fans mobbed her while she was entering her Uber. Ripley took to social media to express her discomfort, reminding fans that wrestlers deserve personal space and respect. She warned against such behavior, hinting at a potential 'Mami' mode if boundaries are crossed.
title: Chaos before Clash: Rhea Ripley mobbed in Paris; sends warning to overzealous fans

author: DEBABRATA MOHAPATRA
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized luxury vehicles and assets worth crores from mining businessman Shakti Ranjan Dash in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, due to his alleged involvement in a Rs 1,396 crore loan fraud case linked to Himachal Pradesh's ITCOL.
title: '10 luxury vehicles, 3 superbikes': ED raids Odisha mining biz

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: In Bihar, over two lakh objections have been filed against the draft electoral roll, primarily from individuals who submitted enumeration forms while already registered elsewhere. This surge follows notices issued to prominent figures for holding multiple voter IDs.
title: 2L file objections seeking their names struck off Bihar poll rolls

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan late Sunday. The quake's epicenter was near Jalalabad. Tragically, two children died and several others were injured. The tremors were felt across eastern Afghanistan and in Islamabad, Pakistan. Afghanistan is prone to earthquakes. This disaster follows recent flooding in Nangarhar province, which caused further devastation. The region faces ongoing challenges.
title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake hits Afghanistan: Children killed, tremors felt in Pakistan

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: WWE Clash in Paris 2025 witnessed Roman Reigns defeating Bronson Reed in a brutal opening match. Post-victory, Reigns attacked Paul Heyman, but Bron Breakker ambushed Reigns with spears, leading to a vicious assault by Reed, who delivered multiple Tsunamis while Reigns was tied up. Jey Uso attempted a save but also fell victim to the duo's onslaught.
title: Clash in Paris results: Roman Reigns wins big; stretchered out after brutal Bronson Reed match

author: TOI Education
description: Growing hostility towards the H-1B visa program in the U.S. is evolving into a politically charged attack, threatening Indian professionals' livelihoods. Rhetoric from figures like Governor DeSantis and others frames Indian workers as threats, fueling anti-immigrant sentiment and discriminatory practices. This environment creates uncertainty for Indian students and professionals seeking opportunities in the U.S. technology sector.
title: DeSantis slams H-1B: US anti-immigrant rhetoric rises; Indians to bear the brunt

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Consumers are facing a double blow as ethanol-blended petrol (E20), despite its higher price, reduces vehicle mileage by 2-6%. Delhi-based engineer Surender Pal Singh experienced a significant drop in his car's mileage, prompting concerns shared by other users on social media.
title: E20 ethanol-blended petrol hits vehicle mileage, users bear brunt

author: FAIZ RAHMAN SIDDIQUI
description: In Etawah, police arrested a pet owner after an 11-year-old boy died from severe dog bite injuries. A post-mortem confirmed the boy's death was due to the dog attack, which included multiple neck wounds. Locals reported the same dog had injured two laborers previously, prompting residents to drive the dog away for safety.
title: Kanpur horror: 11-year-old mauled to death by pet dog; owner arrested

author: JAI NARAIN PANDEY
description: Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' concluded in Patna, signaling Congress's resurgence in Bihar after nearly three decades. The yatra, a united opposition show, highlighted Congress's assertive strategy, potentially unsettling its alliance with RJD. While Tejashwi Yadav symbolically positioned himself as the 'charioteer,' Congress avoided endorsing any CM candidate, focusing on grassroots revival and seat-sharing negotiations, hinting at future political dynamics.
title: Lok Sabha 2029 in mind? Congress uses ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’ to reclaim ground

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: President Xi Jinping proposed suggestions for a healthy China-India relationship, emphasizing that the border issue shouldn't define the overall bilateral ties. However, PM Modi stressed that the boundary situation impacts relations, highlighting the need for border peace. Both leaders acknowledged the importance of their relationship for global stability, with discussions also involving future cooperation.
title: SCO Summit: Xi presents 4-point plan to upgrade India-China ties - how PM Modi responded

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: A devastating fire engulfed the Shree Sorathia Prajapati Community Centre in Ilford, east London, on Saturday night, completely destroying the building. Fortunately, no one was injured as devotees were participating in a Ganesh Chaturthi procession when the fire erupted. Authorities are investigating the cause, but preliminary information suggests it was not intentional.
title: ‘There was a blast from within': Fire guts Hindu community centre in London; probe on

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju assured that tribals in the northeast and other regions would be exempt from the proposed Uniform Civil Code, allowing them to maintain their social systems. Speaking at an event, Rijiju highlighted the government's commitment to UCC while respecting tribal autonomy.
title: ‘Tribals exempt from UCC’: Rijiju clarifies govt stand

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Dallas Mavericks guard Klay Thompson believes Anthony Davis is the best power forward. Thompson is excited about the team's frontcourt potential for the 2025-2026 season. He praised Davis's skills and the team's depth. Davis's health is crucial for Dallas's Western Conference hopes. The Mavericks acquired Davis from the Los Angeles Lakers.
title: 'Two-way force': Thompson praises teammate Davis; calls him 'best power forward of his gen'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Millionaire CEO Piotr Szczerek, infamous for snatching a signed hat from a child at the US Open, allegedly defended his actions in a statement, claiming "first come, first served." He also threatened legal action against online critics. "I understand that some people might not like it, but please, let's not make a global scandal out of the hat. It's just a hat. If yoy were faster, you would have it," he reportedly said on a Goworkd forum.
title: 'So what I took the hat': Rich Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek now threatens online trolls

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump defended his trade policy after a court declared most of his tariffs illegal. He thanked a judge who sided with him. Trump claimed tariffs brought trillions of dollars to the US. A court ruled Trump overstepped his authority with the tariffs. The levies were set to cover about 69 percent of US imports.
title: 'Country would be completely destroyed': Trump defends tariffs after US court setback

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: UFC President Dana White made a quiet donation in 2010. He gave $50,000 to save a Thai girl's life. The girl needed urgent liver surgery. Ben Pittsley shared the story on social media. White's act contrasts with public charity. Fans appreciate his private kindness. He also supported Ben Askren's transplant.
title: Dana White’s $50K transplant donation sparks comparison with Dwayne Johnson & MrBeast

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Luka Doncic achieved a triple-double, leading Slovenia to victory against Belgium in EuroBasket. He became the fourth player to achieve this feat. Edo Muric praised Doncic's relentless desire to win. Muric highlighted Doncic's competitive spirit in all aspects of life. Slovenia secured their first victory in EuroBasket. Coach Aleksander Sekulic emphasized Doncic's focused mindset.
title: Luka Doncic makes history in EuroBasket 2025 as teammate Edo Muric hails the NBA pro

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Melinda French Gates revealed that Bill Gates, despite his demanding role as Microsoft CEO, made time to drive their eldest daughter to preschool daily. This decision, initially a family negotiation, surprisingly inspired other parents to share domestic responsibilities more equitably. The car rides became cherished moments for Bill and his children, highlighting the importance of balancing work and family.
title: Parenting choice: Gates on picking daughter’s school; small choice, big impact

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The White House has reportedly directed the General Services Administration (GSA) to expedite the addition of Elon Musk's xAI and its Grok chatbot to the list of approved vendors for government use. This directive follows a previously scuttled partnership due to Grok's controversial antisemitic content generation.
title: White House on Musk’s Grok: Recovers from Hitler row; urges xAI return

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Donald Trump has publicly advocated for Roger Clemens' Hall of Fame induction, drawing parallels to Pete Rose's situation. Clemens, despite his stellar career, faced Hall of Fame challenges due to steroid allegations and failed to garner enough votes during his ten years on the Baseball Writers' Association of America ballot.
title: Clemens’s immediate Hall of Fame induction! Trump cited Pete Rose case, why?

author: TOI Education
description: A Bengaluru international school's ₹7.35 lakh annual fee for Grade 1 has ignited a debate on affordability and access to quality education. The viral fee structure sparked outrage, with many questioning if even high-income families can afford such costs. This controversy highlights the growing disparity in education expenses, raising concerns about whether quality education is becoming a luxury in India.
title: Bengaluru school fee shock: Rs 7.35L for Grade 1; Rs 11L for Class 12

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Meta's Superintelligence Lab, established by Mark Zuckerberg, is facing challenges in retaining top AI talent, leading to high-profile departures. Frustration over bureaucracy, internal competition for resources, and leadership style of newly hired executives like Alexandr Wang are contributing factors. This turbulence raises questions about Meta's ability to navigate the AI race amidst significant organizational shifts.
title: Meta’s AI shake-up: Top staff leaves; Reason may be internal clashes over power

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: During a meeting at the SCO summit in Tianjin, Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping addressed cross-border terrorism, recognizing its impact on both India and China. PM Modi emphasized the necessity of mutual understanding and support in combating this shared threat. He also highlighted the importance of peace along the border for fostering India-China relations based on trust and respect.
title: PM Modi, Xi discussed Pak's cross-border terror; MEA says China offered cooperation

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi's visit to Tianjin for the SCO Summit marked his first trip to China in over seven years, following a visit to Japan. Discussions with President Xi Jinping emphasized a partnership approach, focusing on trade expansion and dispute resolution. Modi also met with President Putin, while the summit addressed trade tensions and included leaders from over 20 nations.
title: SCO Summit: Bilateral with Putin, plenary address - PM Modi's agenda on Day 2

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi's China visit after seven years signals a potential reset in relations amidst global trade tensions. Discussions with President Xi Jinping focused on enhancing mutual trust, maintaining border peace, and expanding bilateral trade and investment. Both leaders emphasized strategic autonomy and the need for cooperation on global issues, viewing each other as development partners, not rivals.
title: SCO Summit: Xi presents 4-point plan to upgrade India-China ties - how PM Modi responded

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nearly 9,000 Tuvalu citizens, representing 82% of the population, have applied for Australia's new climate visa program. This initiative, part of the Falepili Union pact, aims to provide a pathway for mobility as climate impacts worsen. The agreement also commits Australia to defend Tuvalu and gives them a say in Tuvalu's defense pacts.
title: Citizenship promise: An entire country is shifting to Australia; first agreement of its kind

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: At the 2025 US Open, CEO Piotr Szczerek ignited global outrage by snatching a signed cap from a child. Identified as the head of Drogbruk, he faced immediate backlash, including negative reviews and deactivated social media. Tennis star Kamil Majchrzak responded by gifting the boy new memorabilia, highlighting Szczerek's reputational crisis.
title: Drama! Millionaire CEO bullies child on camera at US open - Watch

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Philadelphia's 2025 rookie class is already turning heads, with Willie Lampkin, Antwaun Powell-Ryland, and Andrew Mukuba earning spots on PFF's Preseason All-Rookie Team. Lampkin's potential on the offensive line, Powell-Ryland's pass-rushing prowess, and Mukuba's impactful plays in the secondary showcase the Eagles' focus on developing young talent. These rookies signal a promising future for Philadelphia.
title: Eagles’ 2025 Rookies: PFF rankings erupt; instant NFL impact shakes preseason

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Krishan Bahadur Pathak, the Indian men's hockey goalkeeper, celebrated his 150th international cap during the Hero Men’s Asia Cup 2025 match against Japan. Overcoming immense personal adversity, including being orphaned at a young age, Pathak has become a mainstay in the Indian team since his debut in 2018.
title: From orphan to 150 caps: Pathak makes history for India at Asia Cup

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that the military targeted Abu Obeida, the spokesman of Hamas’s armed wing. This announcement comes amidst Israel’s ongoing war in Gaza, during which it has eliminated key Hamas figures. Hamas confirmed the death of Mohammed Sinwar, believed to be its leader in Gaza, adding another layer to the conflict's complexities.
title: Abu Obeida killed: Israel eliminates Hamas spokesperson, confirms Netanyahu

author: GAURAV GUPTA
description: Sarfaraz Khan's hopes for the upcoming Test season have been dashed as a quadriceps injury sustained during the Buchi Babu Tournament has ruled him out of the Duleep Trophy. Dhruv Jurel is also sidelined with a groin injury, while Tilak Varma will miss the tournament due to Asia Cup duty, resulting in Azharuddeen leading South Zone.
title: Big blow! Sarfaraz Khan ruled out of action for three weeks with injury

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, faced immense backlash after a video surfaced showing him snatching a signed hat from a child at the US Open. Social media users identified Szczerek and his company, leading to a flood of negative reviews and criticism. Tennis star Kamil Majchrzak who signed the hat responded to the row and tracked down the child, Brok, and gifted him a new signed cap and other memorabilia.
title: 'Nothing is more disgusting than a child bully': Who is Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek?

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.
title: Shedeur Sanders' message to Deion Sanders: Proves Sanders legacy of resilience

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Bumble CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd is developing a new AI matchmaking app, separate from Bumble, designed to create deeper user profiles based on past relationships and dating experiences. Wolfe Herd humorously admits she wouldn't have swiped right on her husband's profile.
title: Tinder co-founder’s confession about husband: 'I’d never swipe right on his profile'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Dyan Cannon, 88, faced an unexpected White House lockout due to a discrepancy in her passport age. Accompanied by fellow actresses and a chef for their podcast, 'God's Table,' Cannon's past age fib caused a delay. Despite the hiccup, Cannon humorously embraced the situation, reaffirming that age is just a number.
title: White House denies entry to actor Dyan Cannon; what did she lie about?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Leaders from the Shanghai Cooperation Organization's ten member states, including India, Russia, and China, are convening in northern China. The SCO, seen as an alternative to US-led approaches, encompasses 40% of the world's population.
title: Big bloc, strong words: SCO flexes global influence; what role is India playing?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Bihar CEO refuted media reports of widespread duplication in the draft electoral rolls (SIR 2025), deeming the claims premature and speculative. He clarified that the draft rolls are open for public scrutiny, inviting objections and verification.
title: Bihar CEO dismisses allegations of duplicate voters in draft rolls

author: TNN
description: In Krishnanagar, a 19-year-old girl, Isha Mallik, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend, Debraj Singha, at her home on Monday afternoon. The police reported that the victim was shot twice at point-blank range after she decided to end their relationship. The accused is currently absconding, and a manhunt has been initiated by the police to apprehend him.
title: Daylight murder in Bengal: 19-yr-old shot twice by boyfriend in front of family

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Nitish Rana, attributing his form to carrying the Hanuman Chalisa, propelled West Delhi Lions into the DPL 2025 final. They secured an eight-wicket victory against East Delhi Riders, chasing down 140 with ease. Rana's unbeaten 45 complemented Ayush Doseja's steady 54. Earlier, the Riders struggled, posting only 139/8. The Lions now face Central Delhi Kings in a highly anticipated final.
title: DPL 2025: Nitish Rana credits Hanuman Chalisa for his form

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Senator Bernie Sanders has urged US health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr to resign, citing actions endangering public health. Sanders criticizes Kennedy's anti-vaccine stance and promotion of debunked conspiracy theories, highlighting the dismissal of the CDC director and resignations of other officials. He warns Kennedy's policies could undermine access to essential immunizations and threaten the childhood immunization schedule.
title: 'Endangering health': Sanders urges Trump's health secretary to resign

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: In a stunning NFL trade, Micah Parsons joins the Green Bay Packers from the Dallas Cowboys. The Packers acquired Parsons in exchange for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Packers legend LeRoy Butler welcomes Parsons by offering to teach him the Lambeau Leap and gifting his former jersey number, anticipating Parsons will elevate the team to Super Bowl contention.
title: ‘Favorite player’: LeRoy Butler’s Lambeau Leap lesson to Micah Parsons

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Harjinder Singh's U-turn killed 3 Haitian immigrants; one had Biden-era work permit

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Captain Harmanpreet Singh scored twice as India edged Japan 3-2 in their second Pool A match of the men’s Asia Cup. Mandeep Singh added an early goal for India, while Kosei Kawabe netted twice for Japan. India had opened their campaign with a 4-3 win over China and will face Kazakhstan next, with the winner earning a World Cup spot.
title: Hockey Asia Cup: Harmanpreet scores twice; India beat Japan 3-2

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pawan Khera alleged that the Election Commission dismissed approximately 89 lakh complaints of irregularities raised by Congress's Booth Level Agents during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Khera questioned the EC's intentions, claiming that BLAs' complaints were rejected with the directive that only individual complaints would be accepted, not those from political parties.
title: 'Hold Bihar SIR again': Congress says EC rejected 89 lakhs complaints

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant is determined to get back on the cricket field after fracturing his toe during the Test match against England. Pant shared a photo of his bandaged foot on Instagram, expressing his eagerness to recover.
title: 'How many more days in this?': Rishabh Pant's injury update goes viral

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: American journalist Rick Sanchez of Russia Today has criticized the US for imposing secondary tariffs on India over Russian oil, calling it disrespectful and ignorant. He highlighted India's autonomy in choosing oil suppliers as a transformational moment, noting India's significance on the global stage.
title: 'India not schoolkid': US journalist slams Trump's Russia oil tariffs

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping, during the SCO Summit in Tianjin, affirmed India and China as development partners, not rivals, emphasising the need to prevent differences from escalating into disputes. They acknowledged their crucial role in stabilising global trade amid US tariffs and discussed expanding bilateral trade, investment and reducing the trade deficit. PM Modi invited Xi to the BRICS summit in India in 2026, highlighting strengthened bilateral relations.
title: India-China ties: PM Modi stresses 'strategic autonomy'; message for Trump?

author: LAKSHIMA SAREEN
description: India's booming AI industry faces a critical talent shortage, with only one qualified engineer available for every ten Generative AI job openings. This scarcity drives salaries sky-high, particularly in AI, cloud computing, and cybersecurity. Tier-2 cities are emerging as tech hubs, fostering greater inclusion and offering new opportunities, but urgent upskilling is needed to sustain India's digital growth.
title: India’s AI demand surges: 10 roles, 1 engineer; skills crisis explained

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India is expected to receive above-normal rainfall in September, exacerbating the already extreme monsoon season. The IMD warns of potential disruptions like landslides and floods, particularly in Uttarakhand and other regions. Northwest and South Peninsular India have already experienced unusually heavy rainfall, leading to devastating floods and landslides in several states.
title: More flash floods, landslides? IMD warns India set for wetter September

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Reports suggest the BCCI has approached MS Dhoni to mentor the Indian team for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Manoj Tiwary humorously commented on Dhoni's elusiveness, questioning his availability. Tiwary also highlighted the potential benefits of Dhoni's experience and the intriguing prospect of him working alongside Gautam Gambhir, while emphasizing that Dhoni's acceptance of the role remains uncertain.
title: MS Dhoni as Team India mentor? Ex-cricketer takes a dig, says 'woh phone uthaye hain na?'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, revealed his intense dedication to work, blurring the lines between his professional and personal life. He admitted to constantly thinking about Nvidia, even during leisure activities, highlighting the relentless drive behind the company's success. This extreme work ethic has propelled Nvidia to a $4 trillion valuation, reflecting a culture of long hours and unwavering focus.
title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on work obsession: Mind always on company

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang lauded TSMC, calling potential investors “very smart,” amidst reports of US interest in acquiring a stake in H20 chip sales to China. Huang revealed TSMC is developing six new Nvidia products, including CPUs and GPUs crucial for AI. Nvidia is also considering bringing its Blackwell processor to China.
title: Nvidia CEO’s pro tip: Jensen Huang says buy stake in TSMC; praises chipmaker

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Severe flooding in Pakistan's Punjab province, exacerbated by global warming, has impacted two million people, marking the region's biggest flood in history. Heavy monsoon rains have caused three rivers to reach unprecedented water levels, leading to widespread evacuations and significant damage.
title: Pak's Punjab faces biggest flood in history: 33 killed, 7 lakh evacuated

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Protests in Australia: Thousands march in Sydney protesting immigrants

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Punjab is grappling with severe flooding, prompting Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to request Prime Minister Modi to release Rs 60,000 crore in pending state funds. The floods, triggered by heavy rains and dam water releases, have devastated seven districts, submerging farmland and impacting livelihoods. The state government has extended school closures and seeks revised disaster relief compensation norms for farmers.
title: Punjab floods: CM Mann seeks Rs 60K cr from Centre; schools closed

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Ciara and Russell Wilson charmed onlookers at the US Open, blending family time with superstar glamour. Their children, Future Zahir and Sienna Princess, added to the heartwarming scene. Beyond the courts, their Why Not You Foundation hosted a fundraiser at MetLife Stadium, aiming to raise $3 million for youth and families.
title: Russell Wilson & Ciara at US Open: Celeb moments steal spotlight

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Russia-Ukraine war: Moscow shoots down 112 drones in one day

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cheteshwar Pujara, after retiring from all cricket forms, received a heartfelt appreciation letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cricket. Modi lauded Pujara's resilience, temperament, and pivotal role in Test cricket, especially his remarkable performances in challenging overseas conditions.
title: Touching tribute! PM Modi to retired Pujara: 'Team's fate was in safe hands'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: In response to the US tariff hike, the government is preparing measures to protect industries and workers, focusing on employment-heavy sectors. Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur expressed confidence in achieving the fiscal deficit target, citing strong macroeconomic fundamentals, robust capex, and broad-based economic expansion reflected in the 7.8% growth in the April-June quarter.
title: US tariffs: India readies steps to protect exporters; domestic demand push in focus

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Jagseer Boparai, a 37-year-old Indian-origin man, tragically died in a car accident in Salisbury, Australia. He lost control of his car, colliding with a tree, bus shelter, and power pole. The accident occurred just weeks before his planned return to India for his wedding, devastating his family and the local community.
title: 'Was saving money for wedding': Indian-origin truck driver dies in Autralia road crash

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Hamas confirmed the death of Mohammad Sinwar, its Gaza military chief. Israel reported killing him in an airstrike months ago. His body was found in a tunnel beneath a hospital in Khan Younis. Mohammad Sinwar played a key role in Hamas's command. His death follows those of other top leaders.
title: Hamas confirms death of its top military commander Mohammad Sinwar

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Salim Khan revealed his family's long-held tradition of abstaining from beef, rooted in Prophet Mohammed's teachings emphasizing the cow's importance. He highlighted the seamless integration of Hindu traditions in his life, predating his marriage to Salma Khan.
title: 'We don't eat beef': Salim Khan on family's food choices

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation in the 125th episode of Mann Ki Baat, expressing sorrow for the havoc caused by incessant rains and highlighting the contributions of disaster response forces. He also mentioned achievements in Jammu and Kashmir, including a cricket match in Pulwama, and spotlighted athletes from the Khelo India Water Sports Festival.
title: From monsoon mayhem to Khelo India fest at Dal Lake: PM Modi's Mann Ki Baat address

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Israeli strike on Yemen kills Ahmed al-Rahawi: Why is he called rebel PM and not PM?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Israel hits Hezbollah site in Lebanon; earlier killed Houthi rebel PM

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Justice Vikram Nath humorously acknowledged the global attention he received after his bench overturned a ruling on stray dogs in Delhi-NCR. He expressed gratitude to CJI BR Gavai for assigning him the case, noting the widespread recognition, even from dogs.
title: 'Made me famous world over': SC judge on stray dogs case

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to recognise a Palestinian state has drawn sharp criticism from Israel and the US. Netanyahu accused Macron of “fueling antisemitism,” while Macron defended the move as vital for peace and in response to Gaza’s humanitarian crisis. The US backed Israel, even as several countries plan similar recognition during the upcoming UN General Assembly.
title: 'Fuelling anti-semitism fire': Why are Israel and US angry at Macron?

author: BASAVARAJ KATTIMANI
description: Sandigawad village in Ron taluk showcases remarkable communal harmony during Ganeshotsav. For the past three years, Hindus and Muslims have jointly celebrated the festival for five days, with the Ganesha idol installed within the local mosque premises. Muslims actively support the Hindu rituals, while Hindus participate in Ramzan, fostering unity.
title: Shared festival: Karnataka village installs Ganesha idol at mosque

author: APEKSHA TANWAR
description: CBSE has launched a nationwide initiative inviting students of Classes IX–XII to participate in podcasts and social media platforms like YouTube. Through videos, audio clips, and testimonials, students can share their voices on academic and personal matters. Schools can nominate students within 10 days via a Google form. The program aims to enhance communication, confidence, and digital engagement.
title: CBSE opens new space: Classes 9–12 on podcasts; real dialogue with students

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The National Highways Authority of India introduced the FASTag annual pass on August 15, enabling private vehicles to use national highways and expressways for a fixed fee of ₹3,000 for the base year 2025-26. Valid for a year or 200 trips, it excludes several major expressways. The pass is non-transferable, requires proper FASTag affixation, and Vehicle Registration Number (VRN) linkage.
title: FASTag Annual Pass: Expressways & highways where fees still apply

author: TNN
description: A Haryanvi actor-singer has accused a Bhojpuri actor-singer of inappropriate touching during a promotional event in Lucknow. She shared her experience on Instagram, expressing anger and humiliation, and stated she will not work in the Bhojpuri industry again. The accused's manager dismissed the allegations as a misunderstanding, while a Bhojpuri Samaj leader condemned the incident.
title: Haryanvi actor-singer accuses Bhojpuri star Pawan Singh of inappropriate touch

author: etimes.in
description: Television actress Priya Marathe, known for her roles in Marathi and Hindi serials, passed away at her Mumbai residence on August 31 at the age of 38. She had been battling cancer for several years. Marathe gained recognition for her performances in 'Kasamh Se,' 'Pavitra Rishta,' and 'Bade Acche Lagte Hain,' leaving behind a legacy of memorable characters and versatility.
title: Pavitra Rishta fame Priya Marathe passes away at 38 after battle with cancer

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in Tianjin, China, for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit hosted by President Xi Jinping. Accompanied by a large delegation, Putin aims to bolster the SCO's ability to address global challenges and strengthen Eurasian solidarity. He emphasized the SCO's principles of equality and respect, envisioning a fairer, multipolar world order.
title: Putin arrives in China; calls for 'fairer multipolar world order'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi affirmed that cooperation between India and China would foster global well-being during bilateral talks with President Xi Jinping. PM Modi emphasized India's commitment to advancing ties with China based on mutual trust, respect, and sensitivity. Discussions included border management agreements, the resumption of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, and direct flights between the two nations.
title: 'Right choice for India-China to be friends': PM Modi, Xi commit to taking ties forward

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's postal department has halted all mail bookings to the United States due to new US regulations impacting incoming shipments. This suspension includes letters, documents, and gifts valued up to $100. The decision follows a US executive order removing duty-free allowances and requiring comprehensive data exchange, which Indian carriers are currently unable to meet.
title: Trump tariffs: India halts US-mail including up to $100 parcels

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel released disturbing security footage depicting the October 7 Hamas attack on the Taasa family home. The video shows a Hamas militant killing firefighter Gil Taasa as he shielded his two sons from a grenade. Injured by shrapnel, the boys witnessed their father's death and were later offered drinks by a fighter before the family's eldest son was also killed.
title: Watch: Israel releases Oct 7 footage; father dies shielding kids from bomb

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: An Air India flight AI2913, en route to Indore, made an emergency return to Delhi shortly after takeoff on Sunday due to a fire warning in its right engine. Following standard safety protocols, the cockpit crew shut down the affected engine and executed a safe landing.
title: Air India flight returns to Delhi after 'fire indication'; passengers shifted

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: The Allu family is mourning the loss of Allu Kanakaratnam, mother of producer Allu Aravind and grandmother of actor Allu Arjun, who passed away at 94. Celebrities including Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan, and Naga Chaitanya offered condolences. Pawan Kalyan, despite his political duties, paid a late-night visit. Allu Arjun and family members acted as pallbearers.
title: Allu Arjun's grandmother's demise: Pawan Kalyan visits residence after Vizag meet

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Manoj Tiwary, the former Indian cricketer, has ignited controversy by advocating for India to boycott their Asia Cup match against Pakistan, scheduled in Dubai on September 14. His call follows the recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which resulted in the deaths of 26 people due to Pakistan-backed terrorism.
title: Asia Cup | 'What is the point of playing with Pakistan?': Ex-India cricketer

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: President Trump celebrated Labor Day weekend by highlighting nearly $10 trillion in new investments aimed at American workers, touting a "Golden Age of Prosperity." The administration pointed to corporate pledges from NVIDIA, Apple, IBM, and SoftBank as evidence of economic momentum. These announcements, combined with job creation and workforce programs, are positioned as part of Trump’s broader economic agenda.
title: ‘Big year ahead’: Trump touts $10tn investment for Americans; WH hails agenda

author: KHUSHI BHUTA
description: Yogendra Singh, a 35-year-old sewadar, was fatally beaten at Delhi's Kalkaji Temple following a dispute over chunni prasad distribution. Singh, a farmer from Uttar Pradesh, balanced his agricultural work with temple service to support his family and his daughter's medical treatment. Five individuals have been arrested in connection with the brutal attack, which eyewitnesses described as chaotic and violent.
title: ‘His wife thinks he is undergoing treatment': Kalkaji Temple sewadar beaten to death

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli forces recovered the remains of Ilan Weiss and Idan Shtivi, who were killed during the October 7th Hamas attack. Weiss was killed in Be'eri, while Shtivi was murdered near the Nova music festival after helping others. Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed to continue efforts to bring all hostages, living and dead, home as Israel intensifies its Gaza offensive.
title: IDF recovers bodies of two October 7 victims from Gaza

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Nitish Rana addressed his on-field spat with Digvesh Rathi during the Delhi Premier League Eliminator, stating Rathi initiated the confrontation. Rana defended his aggressive response, emphasizing his upbringing taught him to stand up for himself when provoked. He highlighted his match-winning innings as a consequence of being challenged, asserting he never starts fights but always retaliates.
title: ‘If someone pokes me, I won’t sit quietly’: Nitish Rana hits back at Digvesh Rathi

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping met in Tianjin. Modi stressed the importance of cooperation between India and China. He noted that the interests of both nations are intertwined. Agreements on border management were reached. The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra has resumed. Direct flights between the two countries are restarting. India aims to strengthen relations with China based on trust and respect.
title: India-China ties: PM Modi, Xi Jinping hold meeting on sidelines of SCO

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Lalit Modi defended releasing unseen footage of the 2008 'Slap-gate' incident, asserting he was simply answering a question truthfully during a podcast with Michael Clarke. This reignited controversy, drawing criticism from S. Sreesanth's wife, Bhuvneshwari, who condemned the act as insensitive and harmful to their families. Harsha Bhogle explained the video's suppression, aimed at protecting the IPL's early image.
title: Lalit Modi hits back at Sreesanth’s wife; defends release of slap-gate video

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Ayesha Curry, wife of Stephen Curry, is in Italy with friends and family. She attended Drake's Milan show as part of his European tour. Curry shared pictures from the concert and celebrated her cousin's birthday. She also posted photos interacting with a horse named Mary. She is a horse enthusiast and has previously celebrated the Kentucky Derby with a watch party at her restaurant.
title: 'Made a new friend': Ayesha Curry's Italy trip moment

author: DEEPTHI SANJIV
description: Udupi police discovered the body of Vasudha Chakravarthy, 45, who had been reported missing since August 27th after visiting Sri Mookambika Temple in Kollur. Following a complaint, searches were conducted, leading to the belief that she jumped into the Sowparnika River. Her body was found approximately 3km away, after being carried through a deep forest.
title: Mystery shrouds death of missing Bengaluru woman; body found in Sowparnika River

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sunil Gavaskar strongly criticised AB de Villiers for questioning Shreyas Iyer's Asia Cup omission, asserting that foreign players should not interfere in Indian cricket matters. Gavaskar emphasised that Indian cricketers refrain from commenting on other nations' selections and accused the Indian media of seeking validation from overseas opinions, reigniting the debate over external influence in Indian cricket.
title: 'None of their business': Gavaskar slams foreign players over Iyer omission remarks

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Priya Marathe, famed for her role in Pavitra Rishta, is no more. She breathed her last at her Mumbai residence. Priya was 38. She played Vidya Bali in Kasamh Se. She also appeared in Comedy Circus's first season. Marathe acted in Pavitra Rishta. She was also seen as Jyoti Malhotra in Bade Acche Lagte Hain.
title: Popular Marathi actor Priya Marathe dies at 38 after battling cancer

author: APEKSHA TANWAR
description: India’s school enrolment has hit a seven-year low at 24.68 crore in 2024–25, driven mainly by a falling birth rate and shrinking primary cohorts, UDISE+ data shows. While government schools lost 59 lakh students, private schools gained almost the same. Dropout rates fell, but southern states with low fertility saw sharper declines, underscoring India’s demographic and educational shift.
title: School enrolment in India hits seven-year low: Is falling birth rate to blame?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: ‘Vande Mataram’ in China: PM Modi gets warm welcome in Tianjin

author: PRATYUSH RAJ
description: Vihaan Malhotra seeks inspiration from his two superstar teammates -- Vaibhav Sooryavanshi and Ayush Mhatre. After an astounding England tour, he is getting ready for another challenging tour of Australia, where the 18-year-old will be deputy to his best friend Mhatre.
title: Vihaan Malhotra: Sacrificed spot for Suryavanshi, Mhatre; now carving his own space

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: In 1973, scientists aboard the Concorde 001 achieved a groundbreaking feat by observing a 74-minute total solar eclipse. By flying at supersonic speeds and synchronizing with the Moon's shadow, they extended totality far beyond ground-based limits. This mission provided unprecedented insights into the solar corona and revolutionized eclipse research, paving the way for future airborne and space-based observations.
title: World’s longest 74-minute solar eclipse: Concorde 001 flew 2,500 km/h

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A major collision involving two tractor-trailers and six passenger vehicles on Interstate 20 near Lindale, East Texas, resulted in injuries to 17 individuals and a complete shutdown of westbound traffic on Saturday. Emergency crews responded to the scene following the 4 pm incident, transporting the injured to local hospitals for treatment of non-life-threatening injuries.
title: Texas I-20 crash: 17 hospitalised after tractor-trailers & cars collide; highway shut

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Vladimir Putin asserted that Russia and China are collaborating to strengthen the BRICS grouping, positioning it as a counterbalance to discriminatory sanctions. He advocated for reforms in global financial institutions, criticizing the existing system's bias towards the West. Putin also highlighted joint efforts within the G20 to prioritize the interests of the Global South.
title: 'Expanding economic opportunities': Ahead of SCO summit Putin backs Brics

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Param Sundari, starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, has earned well in its first two days. The film's domestic earnings reached Rs 16.25 crore. It surpassed Mere Husband Ki Biwi's lifetime earnings. However, it trails Chennai Express in day two collections. Critics cited a weak screenplay, but audiences enjoyed the lead pair's chemistry and music.
title: Param Sundari box office day 2: Janhvi Kapoor starrer earns Rs 9 cr

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: Rumors swirl around a potential blockbuster trade between the Golden State Warriors and San Antonio Spurs. The Warriors are reportedly eyeing Spurs guard Stephon Castle, offering Brandin Podziemski, Gui Santos, and a protected 2028 first-round pick. Golden State aims to bolster their backcourt defense and find a successor to Stephen Curry.
title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors eye $41.35mn Spurs star

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Tony Ferguson marked a victorious boxing debut, defeating Salt Papi in Manchester. Ferguson secured a TKO in the third round, claiming the Misfits Boxing Pro interim middleweight title. This win breaks Ferguson's eight-fight losing streak in MMA. Dillon Danis challenged Ferguson post-fight, hinting at a future match. Ferguson's boxing debut offers a fresh start after UFC setbacks.
title: Tony Ferguson vs Salt Papi: Third-round TKO in thrilling Misfits debut

author: POULAMI ROY
description: The West Bengal School Service Commission (WBSSC) has released a list of 1,804 "specifically tainted" candidates barred from upcoming recruitment exams, complying with a Supreme Court deadline. These candidates' appointments from the 2016 State Level Selection Test (SLST) were flagged due to discrepancies.
title: SSC publishes list of 1,804 ‘tainted’ candidates in 2016 appointments

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: For the first time this millennium, excluding the Covid period, Indian visits to the US declined in June 2025, dropping 8% to 2.1 lakh. This fall aligns with an overall decrease in international visitors to the US. While industry experts hesitate to attribute the decline solely to stricter visa policies, concerns are rising, particularly regarding student visas.
title: Travel slump: June sees a dip in number of Indian visitors in US; first decline since 2001

author: TNN
description: Punjab is grappling with severe floods, the worst since 1988, impacting over 1,000 villages and damaging crops across 3 lakh acres. Rescue operations have evacuated thousands as the Sutlej, Beas, and Ravi rivers overflow due to heavy rains. Three deaths have been reported, and relief efforts are underway with multiple agencies involved in rescue and aid distribution.
title: Punjab’s worst floods in nearly 4 decades: 1,018 villages submerged, crops damaged

author: SUKUMAR MAHATO
description: Eight migrant workers from Murshidabad were brutally assaulted in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, by a mob who accused them of being 'Bangladeshi cattle thieves'. Abdul Alim, one of the victims, recounted the horrific attack, stating that the attackers chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' while beating them. He managed to escape and return home, while the others are reportedly receiving treatment in Bhubaneswar.
title: 8 Bengali workers assaulted in Odisha; 1 survives to tell tale of horror

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Feud at Diana’s grave: Prince William and Prince Harry split over ...

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Ahead of Modi's meeting with Putin, Zelenskyy sought India's support for a ceasefire, citing continued Russian strikes on civilians. Jaishankar defended India's stance on the Ukraine conflict amid criticism from the US regarding trade ties with Russia. Zelenskyy expressed hope Modi would convey a strong message to Putin at the SCO summit, emphasizing the need for immediate de-escalation.
title: Ahead of Modi-Putin talks, Zelenskyy urges PM to send right signal to Russia

author: TNN
description: In a gruesome incident in Delhi's KN Katju Marg, Yogesh Sehgal murdered his wife and mother-in-law following an argument over birthday gifts for their son. The police arrested Sehgal in Rohini, recovering the murder weapon and blood-stained clothes. Domestic disputes and a heated exchange about gifts reportedly triggered the violent act, leaving the family shattered and the community in shock.
title: Delhi man kills wife, mother-in-law with scissors after row over son's bday gift

author: SOUMITRA BOSE
description: A 17-year-old in Nagpur meticulously planned the murder of a 16-year-old girl, purchasing a knife online. Despite being a minor, police are seeking to try him as an adult due to the premeditation involved. The victim's family had previously reported threats from the accused, but a police compromise attempt failed, ultimately emboldening him.
title: 'Purchased Rs 450 knife online': Jilted lover kills Class 10 girl; stalked her for days

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Melania Trump for Nobel Peace Prize? Surprise twist

author: PATHIKRIT CHAKRABORTY
description: A judicial report reveals that the Yogi Adityanath government ended the Hindu exodus from Sambhal by restoring law and order. Since 2017, over a thousand illegal encroachments were removed, including those on religious sites. Infrastructure upgrades, such as new police stations and surveillance, were implemented. Sambhal's economic growth is evident, ranking 10th in UP exports, fostering confidence among citizens.
title: 'Exodus ended': Judicial report credits Yogi govt; new police stations, CCTV deployed

author: TNN
description: Employees of Canara Bank in Kochi, under the BEFI banner, protested against the regional manager's alleged ban on serving beef in the bank's canteen. The employees served beef on the premises, claiming the manager, instructed the canteen staff to exclude the dish due to his personal dietary preferences.
title: Kerala bank canteen row: Manager bans beef; staff serve dish in protest
